abstract.p: Tzvi Shmay-a Engel, Brooklyn resident, comments on his personal observation of July 4, without frills (S)

block.p: While some people in Sea Gate, Brooklyn were skillfully positioning themselves along the neighborhood's shoreline to view the tall ships, Tzvi Shmay-a Engel stuck to his regular routine.

Around 8:45 a.m. Mr. Engel, an Orthodox Jew, walked his son to a religious day camp. He said he planned to spend Independence Day trying to start a dot-com company in his garage. Mr. Engel said that at 38, he had outgrown fireworks. Still, he observed the holiday in his own way.

''I think to celebrate freedom and all the frills is a state of mind,'' said Mr. Engel. ''Of course some people have more outward expressions, but essentially, it's a state of mind.''
